page.title: 04TRAFFIC ENTERING DIGSWELL
page.content: Between 11 am and 11.45 am on June 20th 1985 we did a survey on the A1000. We were able to record traffic movements into and out of our Domesday area via the A1(M). We found that movement into and out of Welwyn was almost equal. There were 6 times as many cars as lorries. Of all the cars, there were as many that were only 2 years old as the rest put together. A lot of these were Cavaliers and Sierras, so we decided most of the drivers must be company reps. who change cars every 2 years. Only 1 in 4 cars had any passengers. We thought people should share and not waste petrol, but then we realised people could be going to all sorts of places once they reached the A1. Blue and red were the most popular car colours, and white was favourite for vans. {SEAN MERCER (11)
